intro: Simsia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf simsia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features alternate, simple to lobed leaves that vary in shape, contributing to its common name. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Simsia heterophylla is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and seasonal blooms.
